column4: hi all, is it really worth using a fresh install to upgrade Ubuntu or will an upgrade from within the OS be equally fine?
A fresh install would definitely be better than an upgrade but you'd have to reinstall all your packages again. Upgrading would save you the headache of installing all packages all over again.
what sort of benefit does it provide? I don't mind reinstall packages if it will mean a better system
Well, if your system is too bloated/cluttered, it helps you remove the clutter. Plus some rogue configs would be cleared of. Boot time would be much better.
right, might do that then. I have a regression bug in the kernel for Lucid that means no audio so I am thinking of making the jump to 10.10 early
you should go ahead then
Why don't you just upgrade the kernel?
well I've upgraded as the updates have come through the update manager, but the bug is not resolved
Latest kernel takes time to appear in update manager (repos). You might want to install manually.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Kernel/Compile
I would do that but each I try seems to have weird quircks
for example, the daily I used a week ago made my screen super tiny
nd it wasn't changing
Well, its not worth the trouble then. BTW, have you filed a bug about your sound problem? Link?
I have - give me a sec I'll find it
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/622070
2.6.35 is available with maverick. You should try that.
I'd suggest you to install maverick.
Alternatively, you might add maverick's repos and install the kernel from there, but that may create some problems, I am not really sure.
I'll go for maverick then
I ran Lucid from beta with no problems
thanks
you're welcome :)
